description:
**Requisition ID**: 211418


Tangerine is Canada’s leading direct bank. We offer flexible and accessible banking options, innovative products, and award\-winning Client service. The reason why Tangerine employees come to work each day is to help Canadians live better lives. We focus on making a difference in our communities, and that includes our own internal community. It’s important to us that our employees feel empowered and enthusiastic about belonging to our Orange culture.

**About Tangerine**
===================


As Canada’s leading digital bank, Tangerine technology is at the heart of everything we do. We redefine digital banking, continually evolving to create innovative, forward\-thinking solutions with our clients’ needs in mind. Our high\-performing, collaborative teams thrive in a high\-trust agile environment, delivering best\-in\-class solutions for our customers. Join us to help shape the future of Canadian banking!

**Role Purpose**
================


As a Mobile Architect, you will lead the design and architecture of Tangerine’s mobile banking applications across multiple platforms (Android and iOS). You will drive technical strategy, set standards, and ensure the delivery of scalable, secure, and high\-quality mobile solutions that impact our customers. You will collaborate with cross\-functional teams and mentor developers, fostering innovation and excellence.

**Key Accountabilities**
========================

* Mobile Architecture \& Strategy: Define and own the mobile application architecture, ensuring scalability, maintainability, and security across Android and iOS platforms.
* Technical Leadership: Serve as the technical authority for mobile development, guiding teams on best practices, emerging technologies, and architectural decisions.
* Code Quality \& Standards: Establish and enforce coding standards, conduct architecture and code reviews, and ensure adherence to performance and reliability benchmarks.
* Mentorship \& Coaching: Mentor senior and junior mobile developers, fostering a culture of continuous learning and technical excellence.
* Collaboration: Partner with Product, Design, QA, Backend, and DevOps teams to deliver seamless, end\-to\-end mobile solutions.
* Performance Optimization: Oversee performance tuning, security hardening, and scalability improvements for mobile applications.
* Innovation: Stay abreast of industry trends, evaluate new tools and frameworks, and drive adoption of innovative solutions.

**Minimum Qualifications**
==========================

* Experience: 8\+ years of professional mobile development experience, including significant experience architecting and delivering complex mobile applications, preferably for both Android and iOS.
* Technical Expertise:
* Deep proficiency in Kotlin and Swift
* Strong understanding of Android and iOS frameworks, components, and design and architectural patterns (MVVM, MVI, MVP, VIPER, etc.).
* Experience with RESTful APIs, third\-party integrations, and mobile security best practices.
* Familiarity with Google’s Material Design and Apple’s Human Interface Guidelines.
* Proficiency with Android Studio, Xcode, Gradle, and version control (Git).
* Experience with automated testing frameworks and CI/CD pipelines for mobile.
* Architecture Skills: Proven track record in designing scalable, modular, and maintainable mobile architectures.
* Agile Methodologies: Comfortable working in Agile/Scrum environments, including sprint planning, estimation, and retrospectives.
* Soft Skills:
* Excellent problem\-solving and analytical skills.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills.
* Ability to lead, influence, and collaborate in a fast\-paced team setting.

 **What's in it for you?**

  

* You will be part of a diverse and inclusive team of Client\-focused go\-getters looking to learn from each other in an environment that celebrates and recognizes success!
* You will have access to thousands of online and in person courses so you can shape your career growth with the support from diverse industry leaders.
* You will get our help to save for your future and to invest in your total wellbeing through our Tangerine benefits\*.
* You belong here, we are equal and un\-complicated. Bring your true self to work, dress codes don’t apply here.
* You will enjoy workspace flexibility and all the excitement that comes from working at the official Bank of the Toronto Raptors.

* Tangerine employees participate in Scotiabank’s pension \& benefits programs (available to permanent employees)


Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto


At Tangerine we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the team, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know.
title: Mobile Architect

description:
**Requisition ID**: 238197


Tangerine is Canada’s leading direct bank. We offer flexible and accessible banking options, innovative products, and award\-winning Client service. The reason why Tangerine employees come to work each day is to help Canadians live better lives. We focus on making a difference in our communities, and that includes our own internal community. It’s important to us that our employees feel empowered and enthusiastic about belonging to our Orange culture.

  

As Canada’s leading digital bank, Tangerine technology is at the heart of everything we do. We have redefined what digital banking is, and we continue to evolve to tackle any opportunity and face every challenge through progressive technology and the power of collaboration.

  

Do you like new challenges? Are you ready to reach new heights in your career and become part of an established disruptor? If so, come join us and help redefine the Canadian banking landscape!

 **What you will be doing:**

  

Contributes to Tangerine’s overall success and growth of Tangerine Investments by building trusted relationships with new and existing clients. Models an entrepreneurial mindset and ensures specific individual activity targets, goals, plans, and initiatives are executed and delivered in support of the team’s business strategies and objectives. Ensures all activities are conducted in compliance with governing regulations and internal policies and procedures.

 **Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:**

  

* Develop and build trusted client relationships by proactively delivering effective investments and financial advice:  

	+ Conduct deep discovery and financial needs assessments to understand clients’ life priorities and preferences, goals, financial position, and risk appetite.
	+ Offer tailored, high\-quality financial advice on investments based on clients’ life priorities and preferences, leveraging strong subject matter expertise of Tangerine investments products, including structure, features, risks, and costs.
	+ Using marketing and lead generation data, and through proactive prospecting outreach, seek out, identify and connect with existing Tangerine clients and prospects to build new client relationships.
	+ Identify and refer opportunities for savings, loans, and other financial services products to provide holistic support and advice.
	+ In client interactions, use language and share information appropriate to the client’s level of investment knowledge, interest, and sophistication.
	
	Educate and empower clients to use online and digital self\-serve tools.  
	+
* Effectively execute business development activities focused on driving growth to the wealth business:
	+ Implement a highly proactive client contact strategy, including planned calls and leveraging referrals.
	+ Ask for referrals from satisfied clients to generate sales and increase market share.
	+ Conduct outbound marketing activities to attract business from new and existing clients.
	
	Work closely with marketing and lead generation teams on strategy and execution.  
	+
* Contribute to the effectiveness of the Tangerine Wealth team:
	+ Establish and maintain personal finance expertise by participating in ongoing professional development.
	+ Keep informed and current on financial services/market trends and new Tangerine products, services, and initiatives.
	+ Work toward meeting productivity goals and targets.
	
	Identify areas and recommend solutions to the Management team to improve the overall client experience.  
	+
* Minimize Tangerine’s exposure to risk:
	+ Ensure all client interactions rigorously adhere to the Global Sales Principles guidelines.
	+ Comply with regulatory activities and guidelines as part of the sales process, including (but not limited to) Privacy, Anti\-Money Laundering/Anti\-Terrorist Financing (AML/ATF), Financial Consumer Agency of Canada (FCAC), Know Your Client (KYC), Canadian Deposit Insurance Corporation (CDIC), Mutual Fund Dealer Association (MFDA) rules, regulations and policies, as well as Scotia Securities Inc. (SSI) guidelines/processes and Guidelines for Business Conduct.
	+ Adhere to Tangerine security procedures, including internal policies and processes, assigned authorities, and limits.
	+ Stay current on compliance and regulatory requirements.
	+ Ensure strict adherence to security procedures, assigned authorities, and limits.
	+ Escalate fraudulent activities, unusual occurrences, and issues/deficiencies/trends to your direct supervisor and/or Manager and/or escalation protocols.

 **Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? We'd love to work with you if you have:**

  

* Expert knowledge of:
	+ Deliver personalized, advice\-driven conversations that reflect client priorities
	+ Uncover client goals and needs through deep discovery
	+ Build long\-term relationships by supporting clients across life stages
	+ Provide informed investment advice using strong product knowledge
	+ Apply market insights to enhance client recommendations
	+ Ensure all interactions meet regulatory and compliance standards
	+ Managing a sales process
* Ability to multi\-task and work in a dynamic and changing environment
* Post\-secondary education in Business or a related field
* Minimum 3\-5 years of work experience, as a financial planner or investment advisor, dealing 1:1 with clients
* Preferably previous registration with an Investment Dealer and experience in Stocks, Bonds, ETFs and Mutual funds
* Minimum Requirement: Licensed as a Mutual Fund Dealing Representatives
* Either working towards or successfully completed either Certified Financial Planner (CFP) or Personal Financial Planner (PFP) designations.
* Fluent verbal and written communication skills in English
* Fluent verbal and written communication skills in French is an asset
* Excellent sales and client service skills
* Proven networking, client acquisition, and interpersonal skills

 **What's in it for you?**

  

* Work in a mission\-driven culture that prioritizes empowerment, diversity, and continuous learning.
* Join a modern banking environment where design plays a central role in shaping client value.
* Be part of a high\-visibility team that is reimagining the future of personal finance in Canada.
* You will get our help to save for your future and to invest in your total wellbeing through our Tangerine benefits\*.
* You belong here, we are equal and un\-complicated. Bring your true self to work, dress codes don’t apply here.
* You will enjoy workspace flexibility and all the excitement that comes from working at the official Bank of the Toronto Raptors.

* Tangerine employees participate in Scotiabank’s pension \& benefits programs (available to permanent employees)

 **What you will be doing:**


We are seeking a Senior DevOps Specialist with strong hands\-on experience in Cloud Migration, devOps Development ( CI/CD pipelines ,Jenkins/Github Action, Terraform), combined with exposure to AI Ops and application modernization initiatives. Our environment is primarily google cloud and you will be leading efforts around building, optimizing, and scaling DevOps practices tailored for Java\-based applications  

The Sr DevOps Specialist will be working to extend the release automation and deployment capabilities across a diverse set of Java based enterprise applications, including but not limited to running source control management in Git through automated build and packaging using Jenkins pipelines, automated deployment and test execution, to automation and provisioning of Cloud\-Based environments based on Kubernetes (both Linux and Windows). The DevOps Specialist is primary responsible for cloud migration , automating and maintaining CI/CD pipeline and CI environments.

 **Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:**

* Working to extend the release automation and deployment capabilities across a diverse set of Java based enterprise applications, including but not limited to running source control management in Git through automated build and packaging using Jenkins pipelines, automated deployment and test execution, to automation and provisioning of Cloud\-Based environments based on Kubernetes (both Linux and Windows).
* Primary responsible for cloud migration , automating and maintaining CI/CD pipeline and CI environments.
* A successful candidate for this position should have past development experience in addition to his devOps skill sets.
* Should have Strong cloud expertise and be comfortable working independently as well as being part of a collaborative environment.
* Hands\-on development experience and breadth of technical skills, the right candidate will also have a good understanding of current best practices, configuration management, and deployment automation.
* Have experienced in release coordinating and deployment and willing to work on overnight deployments.
* Ideal candidates will have a financial services background, preferably with experience working at one or more of the Big Five Canadian banks or any similar institutions.
* Candidate should be comfortable acting as an architect and project lead, driving strategic DevOps transformations across complex financial applications and infrastructure.

 **Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? We'd love to work with you if you have:**

* Proficient in knowledge of technologies and processes like Agile Software Delivery, Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery, DevOps, GitOps, Cloud Native Technologies including Docker Containers and Kubernetes, and Deployment Automation \& Orchestration.
* Maintain a technical proficiency with respect to programming languages, scripts and processes to ensure that Tangerine is well positioned for technological advances in the marketplace.
* Ability to use a wide variety of open source technologies and cloud services (GCP and GKE).
* Assist/support developers troubleshooting efforts of applications in development environments. Timely resolution/investigation of deployments and development environments issues.
* Maintain and manage the non\-Production environments to ensure stability and uptime.
* Develop Jenkins CICD pipelines\-as\-code to run and maintain non\-Production environments to ensure stability and uptime.
* Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge.
* Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day\-to\-day activities and decisions.
* Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas in accordance with Tangerine’s Values, its Code of Conduct and the Global Sales Principles, while ensuringthe adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day\-to\-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational, compliance, AML/ATF/sanctions and conduct risk.
* Champions a high performance environment and contributes to an inclusive work environment.
* Responsible for Mobile Strategy, Deployment and releases \- iOS and Android

 **What's in it for you?**

* You will be part of a diverse and inclusive team of Client\-focused go\-getters looking to learn from each other in an environment that celebrates and recognizes success!
* You will have access to thousands of online and in\-person courses so you can shape your career growth with support from diverse industry leaders.
* You will get our help to save for your future and to invest in your total well\-being through our Tangerine benefits.
* You belong here, and we are equal and uncomplicated. Bring your true self to work, dress codes don’t apply here.
* You will enjoy workspace flexibility and all the excitement that comes from working at the official Bank of the Toronto Raptors.

**Requisition ID**: 246517


Tangerine is Canada’s leading direct bank. We offer flexible and accessible banking options, innovative products, and award\-winning Client service. The reason why Tangerine employees come to work each day is to help Canadians live better lives. We focus on making a difference in our communities, and that includes our own internal community. It’s important to us that our employees feel empowered and enthusiastic about belonging to our Orange culture.

  

The Risk Management mandate is to provide oversight, monitoring and reporting of all operational, credit and market risks, including fraud exposures on an enterprise\-wide basis. It is comprised of four well\-defined functions: Operational Risk Management, Retail Credit Risk Management, Wholesale Credit Risk Management and Market Risk Management. The Senior Manager of Strategic Initiatives and Portfolio Oversight, Credit Risk is accountable for monitoring the various credit portfolios at Tangerine to ensure we are staying within risk appetite. This role is also responsible for managing our strategic roadmap within credit risk. The Senior Manager will report directly to the Director, Retail Credit Risk. Primary elements include: ownership of the deck for the monthly Local Risk Credit Committee, creation of new reports to enhance the oversight of the portfolio such as early warning reporting, ownership of the credit risk roadmap, and representing the team on large strategic projects. **Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:*** Provide Credit Risk leadership and execution expertise with particular focus on the Credit Card program, working with stakeholders across Tangerine and Bank of Nova Scotia Risk teams, Product, Marketing, frontline operations and vendors.
* Develop a reporting framework to ensure continued portfolio health moving forward
* Lead reporting and ongoing enhancement of credit policy and risk strategy to drive organic business growth and loss mitigation plans with balanced risk/reward trade\-off.
* Manage portfolio loss results to acceptable levels, while supporting business profitability objectives, regulatory requirements and Tangerine’s client centric business mission.
* Provide coaching and mentoring to foster a strong risk discipline environment.
* Collaborate with Acquisition risk and Operations risk teams to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements.
* Lead and support the development and implementation of credit risk and loss mitigation plans and provide insight to business leaders through ad hoc requests, projects and initiatives.
* Bring a sense of urgency in driving initiatives through to the finish line
* Responsible for understanding and complying with the Regulatory Compliance Framework including the Anti\-Money Laundering/Anti\-Terrorist Financing and Sanctions Policy and all AML related policies, procedures and controls within the department.
* Other duties as assigned.
 **Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? \- We'd love to work with you if you have:*** University Degree in business or equivalent
* Minimum 10 years of financial services experience, with particular focus and emphasis on Credit Risk
* Proven leadership in operational function support, system and project implementation and vendor management
* Proven leadership in the establishment of procedure structure, policies and/or programs within a business or function
* Strong capability to work with senior business leaders
* Strong ability to lead cross functional teams and collaborate effectively in high pressure environment
* Strong presentation and “story\-telling” skills
* Aptitude for innovation and readiness to “roll up sleeves” and do what is necessary to deliver on business objectives
* Excellent leadership and communication
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Strong attention to detail
* Strong change management and people development skills
 **What’s in it for you?*** An inclusive \& collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success!
* We offer a competitive rewards package: Performance bonus, Employee Share Ownership Program, and Pension Plan Matching, Health Benefits from day one!
* Your career matters! You will have access to career development and progression opportunities.

* Minimum 6\-8 years of marketing experience in demanding digital\-oriented Tier\-1 organizations (e.g. Telco, Banking, Retail, Technology, etc.)
* Minimum 6\-8 years of strategic digital marketing experience, working in an agile/quick to market environment is an asset
* Hands\-on experience with journey orchestration platforms such as Adobe Journey Optimiser (AJO), Braze, or similar tools for designing and managing customer journeys.
* Familiarity with analytics platforms like Google Analytics (GA) or Adobe Analytics for measuring and optimizing campaign performance.

The reason why Tangerine employees come to work each day is to help Canadians live better lives. We focus on making a difference in our communities, and that includes our own internal community. It’s important to us that our employees feel empowered and enthusiastic about belonging to our Orange culture.

  

Are you ready to make the change and become part of an established disruptor with the backing of a highly engaged team? If so come join us and help redefine the Canadian banking landscape!

 **What you will be doing:**


The Quality Engineering (QE) Lead provides support to Senior Manager, Quality Engineering and is responsible for the oversight and coordination of testing and quality engineering activities within the banking domain. Responsibilities include automation, testing, planning, coaching, leading and supervising tasks and/or testing team. The lead will also support testing strategy, design, execution, defect management, reporting are executed and delivered in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies and procedures. The QE Lead will report directly to Senior Manager, Quality Engineering.

 **Is this role right for you?**

* Day\-to\-day coordination of QE squad, including overseeing and carrying out following type of testing: Functional Testing (including automation), Integration Testing, Regression Testing, Accessibility Testing, User Acceptance Testing, Production Acceptance Testing and other types of testing as required
* Delivering the automation results for the dedicated channel, based on the strategic directives set forth by leadership team
* Coach and provide mentorships to test team members in various areas including business domain, functional testing, automation and non\-functional testing while ensuring the test teams are compliant with Tangerine test methodologies and industry best practices
* Recommending and implementing various processes or framework enhancements by collaborating with QE community within the bank
* Manage and lead testing activities for multiple large\-scale enterprise\-wide programs/projects for Tangerine that are executed in Agile methodology
* Assess the risks associated with the development aspects of each solution/project and define approach for manual versus automation testing and institute change within the team
* Risk Management – document testing risks and provide mitigation and contingency plans from testing standpoint
* Collect strategic, technical and operational test metrics. Analyze current defects and test execution trends and extrapolate data for predictive analysis
* Work with people of varied levels within QE and/or outside of QE Team including Business/Product, Engineering, PMO, Release Management, Design, etc. to meet key objectives and advocate for quality
* Responsible for team’s adherence to governance and processes, timely management of any issue or escalation and facilitate overall escalation processes
* Manage and review documentation and creating testing artifacts (e.g., test strategies, plans, estimates, test cases, metrics/dashboard, defects log/report, signoffs) to ensure artifacts adhere to prescribed standards and audit requirements

 **Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role?**


* 10\+ years of solid experience working within SDLC/TDLC
* 5\+ years of solid testing experience within wealth management domain
* 5\+ years of experience with Mobile and Web technologies
* 5\+ years of experience managing onshore or offshore team
* Proficient testing background in the Canadian financial services industry
* University or College Degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science/Engineering
* Must have hands on experience with Test Automation using Selenium Webdriver IO or similar, and ability to contribute to automation framework enhancements
* Extensive knowledge of Java script, Type script etc
* Proficient with API REST/SOAP testing and experience using related tools like Rest Assured etc
* Experience with CI/CD and related tools and techniques; Jenkins/Dockers/Kubernetes
* Expertise in utilizing accessibility tools across web and mobile such as ANDI, AXE, Voice Over/TalkBack, NVDA
* Strong experience in Database Testing \- analyzing data received from different data sources including RDBMS, My SQL and other databases
* CTFL, ISTQB,CSQA,CSTE good to have

 **What's in it for you?**

* You will be part of a diverse and inclusive team of Client\-focused go\-getters looking to learn from each other in an environment that celebrates and recognizes success!
* You will have access to thousands of online and in\-person courses so you can shape your career growth with support from diverse industry leaders.
* You will get our help to save for your future and to invest in your total well\-being through our Tangerine benefits\*.
* You belong here, and we are equal and uncomplicated. Bring your true self to work, dress codes don’t apply here.
* You will enjoy workspace flexibility and all the excitement that comes from working at the official Bank of the Toronto Raptors.

 **Position Title: Bilingual Funding and Support Analyst**

  

As Canada’s leading digital bank, Tangerine technology is at the heart of everything we do. We have redefined what digital banking is, and we continue to evolve to tackle any opportunity and face every challenge through progressive technology and the power of collaboration.

  

Do you like new challenges? Are you ready to reach new heights in your career and become part of an established disruptor? If so, come join us and help redefine the Canadian banking landscape!

 **What you will be doing:**  



Client Business Support (CBS) is a client focused processing department that enables the bank to demonstrate that a virtual bank can offer superior client experience by efficiently and effectively delivering on the promises made to our clients.

  

The CBS department is made up of several teams; each team plays a unique role in providing support for both Deposit/Chequing and Lending products.


The Bilingual Funding and Support Analyst position involves the timely and prudent administration of mortgage requests. This includes the processing of lawyer Instructions, the ordering and maintenance of appraisals, Income verifications, Funding and the processing of Final Documentation as required for mortgage applications. It must be ensured that a consistent service is delivered to the CBS \- Lending department through the timely and accurate delivery of the Funding and Support activities.

 **Is this role right for you?** **In this role, you will:**

  

* Managing a busy workflow while maintaining a high level of accuracy and meeting defined service standard
* Develop and maintain positive working relationships with Internal and External Clients
* Sound, effective and prompt review of verification of Income documentation
* Maintaining a high level of accuracy and consistency in document verification and disbursement release
* Meeting defined service standards and turnaround times
* Liaising with different areas of the department and developing relationships to ensure that job is done and to ensure the smooth completion of all closings
* Liaising with external partners to confirm satisfactory delivery of documentation
* Prioritization of allocated workflow
* Regular review and processing of Registration Documentation.
* Good knowledge of Funding, and conditions set for the Solicitors. Being able to process deals like i.e. Purchases, ETO’s, Add Helocs, Mortgage Increases, Refinances and Switches.
* Review and validate of all legal documentation / Interim report received from Solicitors
* Review and satisfied the Identification Verification Form in accordance with Tangerine requirements
* Review and satisfied all additional Funding conditions prior to releasing Mortgage funds to Solicitor
* Providing Funding projections and daily balancing reports
* Processing and releasing of wires
* Suggestions on process flow improvement
* Thorough knowledge of Tangerine’s mortgage guidelines, processes and procedures including: CMHC, Genworth and familiarity with Tangerine’s Charge Terms as they pertain to Mortgage Servicing
* Customer Service levels are met relating to e\-mails, phone messages and fax enquiries, this is done by ensuring all e\-mails, phone messages and fax enquiries are responded to within 2hrs
* Reporting \& tracking, analyze data related to the team, team members and the unit as a whole
* Keep abreast of all Lending Credit Policies, Guidelines and Procedures

 **Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role?** **\- We'd love to work with you if you have:**

* Completion of a post\-secondary degree or experiences in financial industry or equivalent professional experience
* Completion or enrollment in mortgage courses
* Mortgage and Credit experience an asset
* Bilingual (French / English) is required
* Computer literate, knowledge of Microsoft Office
* Professional proficiency in all aspects of the business
* Ability to build relationships at all levels
* Ability to adapt to changing needs and priorities

description:
**Numéro de la demande:** 246344

  

Tangerine est la plus importante banque directe au Canada. Nous offrons des options bancaires souples et accessibles, des produits novateurs et un service à la clientèle primé. La raison pour laquelle les employés de Tangerine se présentent au travail chaque jour est d'aider les Canadiens à vivre une meilleure vie. Nous nous efforçons de faire une différence dans nos communautés, et cela inclut notre propre communauté interne. Il est important pour nous que nos employés se sentent responsabilisés et enthousiastes à l'idée d'appartenir à notre culture d’entreprise.

 **Titre du poste : Analyste bilingue – Financement et soutien**

  

En tant que première banque numérique au Canada, la technologie de Tangerine est au cœur de tout ce que nous faisons. Nous avons redéfini ce qu’est la banque numérique et nous continuons d’évoluer pour saisir chaque opportunité et relever chaque défi grâce à une technologie de pointe et à la force de la collaboration.


Aimez\-vous relever de nouveaux défis? Êtes\-vous prêt(e) à atteindre de nouveaux sommets dans votre carrière et à faire partie d’un acteur disruptif bien établi? Si oui, joignez\-vous à nous et contribuez à redéfinir le paysage bancaire canadien!

 **Ce que vous ferez :**


Le service **Client Business Support (CBS)** est un département axé sur le client qui permet à la banque de démontrer qu’une banque virtuelle peut offrir une expérience supérieure en respectant efficacement et rapidement les engagements pris envers nos clients.


Le département CBS est composé de plusieurs équipes; chacune joue un rôle unique en offrant un soutien pour les produits Dépôt/Compte\-chèques et Prêts.


Le poste d’**Analyste bilingue – Financement et soutien** consiste à administrer de manière prudente et rapide les demandes hypothécaires. Cela inclut le traitement des instructions des avocats, la commande et la gestion des évaluations, la vérification des revenus, le financement et le traitement de la documentation finale requise pour les demandes hypothécaires. Il est essentiel de garantir un service constant au département CBS – Prêts grâce à une exécution rapide et précise des activités de financement et de soutien

 **Ce rôle est\-il fait pour vous? Vous devrez :**

* Gérer un flux de travail chargé tout en maintenant un haut niveau de précision et en respectant les normes de service définies
* Développer et maintenir des relations positives avec les clients internes et externes
* Examiner rapidement et efficacement les documents de vérification des revenus
* Maintenir une grande précision et cohérence dans la vérification des documents et la libération des fonds
* Respecter les normes de service et les délais
* Collaborer avec différentes équipes du département pour assurer la bonne réalisation des tâches et la clôture des dossiers
* Communiquer avec les partenaires externes pour confirmer la livraison satisfaisante des documents
* Prioriser le flux de travail attribué
* Examiner et traiter régulièrement la documentation d’enregistrement
* Avoir une bonne connaissance du financement et des conditions imposées aux avocats; être capable de traiter des dossiers tels que : achats, ETO, ajout de marges de crédit hypothécaires, augmentations de prêts, refinancements et transferts
* Examiner et valider toute la documentation légale / rapport intérimaire reçu des avocats
* Vérifier et satisfaire le formulaire de vérification d’identité conformément aux exigences de Tangerine
* Vérifier et satisfaire toutes les conditions de financement avant de libérer les fonds hypothécaires à l’avocat
* Fournir des projections de financement et des rapports quotidiens d’équilibrage
* Traiter et libérer les virements
* Proposer des améliorations au processus
* Connaissance approfondie des lignes directrices, processus et procédures hypothécaires de Tangerine, y compris : CMHC, Genworth et familiarité avec les conditions de charge de Tangerine liées au service hypothécaire
* Respecter les niveaux de service pour les courriels, messages téléphoniques et demandes par fax (réponse dans les 2 heures)
* Effectuer des rapports et suivis, analyser les données liées à l’équipe, aux membres et à l’unité dans son ensemble
* Se tenir informé(e) des politiques, lignes directrices et procédures de crédit.

 **Compétences requises pour réussir dans ce rôle :**

* Diplôme postsecondaire ou expérience dans le secteur financier ou expérience professionnelle équivalente
* Achèvement ou inscription à des cours hypothécaires
* Expérience en hypothèques et crédit (atout)
* Bilinguisme (français / anglais) requis
* Maîtrise des outils informatiques, connaissance de Microsoft Office
* Professionnalisme dans tous les aspects du travail
* Capacité à établir des relations à tous les niveaux
* Capacité à s’adapter aux besoins et priorités changeants

 **Ce que nous offrons :**

* Vous ferez partie d’une équipe diversifiée et inclusive, axée sur le client, qui aime apprendre les uns des autres dans un environnement qui célèbre et reconnaît le succès!
* Vous aurez accès à des milliers de cours en ligne et en personne pour façonner votre développement de carrière avec le soutien de leaders issus de divers secteurs.
* Nous vous aiderons à épargner pour votre avenir et à investir dans votre bien\-être global grâce à nos avantages Tangerine\*.
* Vous avez votre place ici : nous sommes égaux et simples.
* Vous bénéficierez d’une flexibilité de travail et de toute l’excitation de travailler pour la banque officielle des Toronto Raptors.
* Les employés de Tangerine participent aux programmes de retraite et d’avantages sociaux de Scotiabank (disponibles pour les employés permanents).


Emplacement(s): Canada : Ontario : North York


Chez Tangerine, nous valorisons les compétences et les expériences uniques que chaque personne apporte à l’équipe. Nous nous engageons à créer et à maintenir un environnement inclusif et accessible. Si vous avez besoin de mesures d’adaptation pendant le processus de recrutement et de sélection, veuillez en informer notre équipe de recrutement.

Scotiabank continues to locate, remove and prevent barriers so that we can build a diverse and inclusive environment while meeting accessibility requirements.

Tangerine is Canada’s leading direct bank. We offer flexible and accessible banking options, innovative products, and award\-winning Client service. The reason why Tangerine employees come to work each day is to help Canadians live better lives. We focus on making a difference in our communities, and that includes our own internal community. It’s important to us that our employees feel empowered and enthusiastic about belonging to our Orange culture.

  

As Canada’s leading digital bank, Tangerine technology is at the heart of everything we do. We have redefined what digital banking is, and we continue to evolve to tackle any opportunity and face every challenge through progressive technology and the power of collaboration.

  

Do you like new challenges? Are you ready to reach new heights in your career and become part of an established disruptor? If so, come join us and help redefine the Canadian banking landscape!

 **What you will be doing:**

  

Support Senior manager to lead and oversee the strategy, flawless execution, and ongoing improvement of channel lead programs with the contact center, squads (including marketing) to drive client primacy, engage and deepen customer relationships and target revenue and profitability objectives for key strategic segments. This role will also support and overseeing the execution of client centric lead programs with the contact center, squads and cross\-functional teams to develop omni\-channel programs that connect digital channels and sales enablement tools to ensure the most optimal sequenced experience for our clients and agents. The role in the short term will also be responsible to support leading the broader contact center sales strategy with many cross\-functional teams to enable inbound and outbound sales opportunities. The role is critical in driving channel sales KPIs through client\-centric and data\-driven program execution and innovation to deepen customer relationships and win the full customer relationship through effective client outreach and advice delivery. Ensures business strategies, plans and initiatives are executed / delivered in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies, and procedures.

 **Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:**

  

* Support Program lead Management
	+ Support lead strategy, by managing execution of contact center lead programs and tactics including launching new programs identified through our client base, outreach journeys and moments of truth
	+ Support the shift to customer centric leads through steady execution and optimization of customer\-centric multi\-product lead programs
	+ Track and measure lead performance across programs with analytics and channel partners on monthly and quarterly basis to distribute to channel and product leadership
	+ Conduct deep dive analyses with analytics to identify new opportunities to enhance existing programs and identify gaps to improve efficiency and conversion rates
	
	Provide or support delivery of lead information required for various cross\-functional teams  
	+
* Program Performance and Optimization
	+ Manage communication to contact center and leadership teams on lead priorities, new leads launching and key messages to drive consistency \& unified approach
	+ Partner with growth squads, marketing and operational sales enablement teams to channel teams to manage lead naming, scripting and resources to support lead programs
	+ Test \& learn new leads, incorporating new capabilities, offers, scripting etc
	+ Manage the prioritization of all sales leads into the contact center
	+ Work across squads and cross\-functional teams to identify new contact center lead opportunities (inbound / outbound)
	+ As certain sales enablement features are unlocked, identify opportunities to plug into existing and new outreach programs
	+ Act as the change champion for enabling lead strategies opportunities into the contact center
	+ Support troubleshooting or problem resolution as required
	+ Optimize front\-line channel growth results through identifying new channel programs to close performance gaps
	+ Work with growth squads to identify always on journeys to sequence digital and contact center channels together based on client needs and key data
	+ Support the contact center sales leads enablement strategy for Tangerine in the short term by working across stakeholders in product, marketing, operations to build the blueprint and gain the appropriate buy in to grow the channel

  

* Lead Forecasting
	+ Support lead forecasting through ongoing updates with Planning and Performance, Squads, contact center and operations to identify any new leads being planned for deployment
	+ Identify any initiatives impacting leads and significant changes to lead volumes and develop quarterly analysis of leads
	+ Support monthly analyzing of contact center leads for leadership in partnership with planning and performance team
	+ Ensure updates to branch leads are integrated with leads and campaign trackers in partnership with planning and performance team

 **Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? We'd love to work with you if you have:**

  

* Post\-secondary education (marketing/business administration preferred)
* 5\+ years of experience, including in Channel Marketing, Channel Programs, Customer Strategy, or Product/Program Management, specifically in organizations with broad geographical distribution network
* Managing delivery of contact center experience is preferred
* Strong ability to build comprehensive strategies and proposals
* Ability to create comprehensive, visually engaging PowerPoint presentations that effectively communicate complex information
* Ability to analyze large data sets and derive insights
* Strong strategic thinking and results focus skills
* Demonstrated success in working cross\-functionally to deliver large, multi\-faceted projects
* Understanding of Retail Products financials and P\&L
* Innovative mindset who is very effective at seeing a strategy through from start to execution

 **What's in it for you?**

  

* Work in a mission\-driven culture that prioritizes empowerment, diversity, and continuous learning.
* Join a modern banking environment where design plays a central role in shaping client value.
* Be part of a high\-visibility team that is reimagining the future of personal finance in Canada.

description:
Requisition ID: 245741  

  

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high\-performing culture.

  

Term: May – August 2026


Work Hours/Week: 37\.5


Application Deadline: 01/16/26

  



There's no better way to kickstart your career than to do a co\-op or internship with Tangerine! During your work term, you’ll have the opportunity to be part of a winning team, build your network, and discover what you love – all while getting paid to do it! There’s a place for every type of student at Tangerine and all that we ask for is that you have passion and strong AOO (Attitude, Ownership and Opportunity).

  



The Velocity Program is not your average internship or co\-op! This is a customized experience that focuses on providing you with the development and tools you need to grow your career. After successfully completing a co\-op or internship with top performance, we will work with you to establish your future placements. As a result, you will get to learn, grow, and experiment within different areas of both Scotiabank and Tangerine!

  



**Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:**

* Be working and partnering with multiple stakeholders within the bank and teams such as contact centers, clients, internal operations teams etc.
* Dive deep into process mapping and gap analysis for client related issues and help find solutions.
* Provide recommendations for improvements to processes and procedures that drive operational excellence or a more amazing client experience.
* Define the scope and the metrics to confirm success for initiatives in collaboration with stakeholders.
* You will help support with a larger scope of team\-wide projects and initiatives as needed.

  



**Do you have the skills and requirements that will enable you to succeed in this role? – We’d love to work with you if:**

* You are currently enrolled in post\-secondary education.
* You love to learn and envision yourself working for an international organization that heavily invests in your future.
* You enjoy being involved in extracurricular activities such as conferences, clubs, and competitions and/or hackathons.
* You have knowledge in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint.
* You have the ability to research, analyze and prepare a report.
* You have Knowledge in SQL series, although not a requirement.
* You are analytical, detailed oriented with strong written and verbal skills.
* You can work on multiple initiatives at the same time.

  



**What’s in it for you?**

* You’ll be part of a diverse, collaborative, innovative, and high\-performing team.
* In\-depth training to prepare you for the role, as well as ongoing coaching and feedback to help you succeed!
* Exclusive student events such as Scotia Student Day, Lunch \& Learns, leadership panels, and much more!
* Bank\-wide orientation to learn more about Scotiabank and gain exposure to senior leadership across the organization.
* You’ll learn about different areas and processes in the bank and how the various functions work.
* You will have exposure to stakeholders within and outside of the team.
* You will have the opportunity to learn and collaborate with projects/initiatives within the operations team.
* You will have the opportunity to learn new systems such as chatbot, IVR (interactive telephony system) which are AI based and help develop these tools.

  



**Please follow the steps below to successfully apply:**


Step 1: Complete your PLUM Profile here and save it as a screenshot.


Step 2: Complete a short one\-way video interview here.


Step 3: Once you have completed your Plum Profile, one\-way video interview, apply to the role on our website. Reminder: when the application asks for your resume, instead upload the screenshot of your PLUM Profile!

  

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto  

  

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.
  

  

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

description:
**Requisition ID**: 245730


Tangerine is Canada’s leading direct bank. We offer flexible and accessible banking options, innovative products, and award\-winning Client service. The reason why Tangerine employees come to work each day is to help Canadians live better lives. We focus on making a difference in our communities, and that includes our own internal community. It’s important to us that our employees feel empowered and enthusiastic about belonging to our Orange culture.

  

Do you like new challenges? Are you ready to reach new heights in your career and become part of an established disruptor? If so, come join us and help redefine the Canadian banking landscape!

 **What you will be doing:**

  

The Technology Business Lead's primary role is to understand the problem we are trying to solve, be hands on and work collaboratively with the teams and stakeholders to define the right solution by eliciting, analyzing, validating, defining and writing requirements that meet the needs across various domains. This role will lead bridging the gap between the business need and the technology solution while keeping customer centricity and digital experience top of mind.


The successful candidate has years of deep, practical business analysis experience with complex cross\-functional features across channels, applications, products \& digitization. In addition, the Technology Business Lead is expected to act as a mentor to Business Analysts and contribute to the Business Analyst Community of Practice (CoP). This role reports directly to the Senior Manager of Business Analyst in the Digital Product Experience (DPX).

 **Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:**

  

* Work with the Product Owner, Technical Lead and stakeholders to capture and document the product vision.
* Responsible to thoroughly understand and communicate stakeholder requirements and distribute relevant information, documentation and artifacts to stakeholders.
* Responsible for the preparation, completion and compliance of business requirements based on business needs; go to person for clarity of vision \& requirements.
* Discover \& elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, use cases, scenarios, business analysis and workflow analysis.
* Supports the Product Owner to manage requirements related activities and deliverables throughout the delivery life cycle (e.g. change requests, issues, risks, schedules, status reporting etc.).
* Work with the Delivery Teams to identify, anticipate, assess, manage and resolve issues and risks related to requirements' activities and deliverables.
* Translate standard business requirements into user stories \& acceptance criteria.
* Support story mapping by decomposing epics into user stories.
* Support the Product Owner with data insights to drive customer centric experiences and priorities.
* Proactively communicate and collaborate with external and internal stakeholders.
* Work collaboratively with cross\-functional matrix teams to develop and maintain thorough knowledge of product, system and process capabilities \& promote customer centric solutions.
* Execute and maintain the requirement traceability matrix to meet audit requirements.

 **Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? We'd love to work with you if you have:**

  

* 5\+ years of experience in a Technology Business Lead role with preference to experience in the digital space (Mobile, Web/Online)
* Agile mindset \& comprehensive knowledge and experience in various delivery models including; agile, waterfall, hybrid frameworks
* Extensive experience with aligning stakeholders and communicating information that enables transparency on the underlying issues and potential solutions.
* Strong analytical skillset required
* Customer centric mentality
* High proficiency in MS Word and MS Visio and thorough experience with as\-is to\-be process flow mapping and sequence diagrams
* High proficiency in the use of JIRA / Confluence
* Strong presentation, facilitation, analysis and problem solving skills
* Able to work independently with focus on time management to meet deadlines
* Ability to deliver seamless execution whether on\-site or remote
* Ability to work in a fast paced, demanding and rapidly changing environment
* Effective leadership skills
* Detail\-oriented with a high degree of accuracy and results\-oriented; be diligent and work with a sense of urgency
* Very strong organizational sense and effective time and priority management
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with diverse groups, managers and subject matter experts and ability to negotiate effectively.
* Strong strategic relationship skills
* Technical background is considered an asset
* Project management experience is an asset
* International Institute of Business Analysis (IIBA) certification is an asset

 **What's in it for you?**

* You will be part of a diverse and inclusive team of Client\-focused go\-getters looking to learn from each other in an environment that celebrates and recognizes success!
* You will have access to thousands of online and in person courses so you can shape your career growth with the support from diverse industry leaders.
* You will get our help to save for your future and to invest in your total wellbeing through our Tangerine benefits\*.
* You belong here, we are equal and un\-complicated. Bring your true self to work, dress codes don’t apply here.
* You will enjoy workspace flexibility and all the excitement that comes from working at the official Bank of the Toronto Raptors.

  

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto


At Tangerine we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the team, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know.

* Experience building, architecting, designing, and implementing data pipelines to support multiple types of downstream needs, ranging from reporting and analytics to production ML inference pipelines and agentic workflows.

* Excellent interpersonal, communication, and influencing skills with the ability to build and foster relationships with business partners, project stakeholders, strategic technology partners and external vendors.

description:
**Requisition ID**: 245152


Tangerine is Canada’s leading direct bank. We offer flexible and accessible banking options, innovative products, and award\-winning Client service. The reason why Tangerine employees come to work each day is to help Canadians live better lives. We focus on making a difference in our communities, and that includes our own internal community. It’s important to us that our employees feel empowered and enthusiastic about belonging to our Orange culture.

 **Purpose**

  

The Senior Accountant is able to work with minimal supervision, understands and resolves complex issues, has a very clear understanding of IFRS standards and trains and assists less experienced members of the team. The incumbent liaisons with other departments or service providers where necessary to investigate and resolve differences, issues and to design and implement process improvements. The Senior Accountant reports directly to the Manager of Finance Control and Analysis.


The Finance Department at Tangerine is primarily responsible for the capture and reporting of financial information for internal and external audiences in accordance with applicable standards. In addition, the Finance Department performs other important functions. The Treasury Administration function administers securitization transactions and ensures transaction details are accurately captured in our administrative systems so that they can be properly valued, accurately accounted for and appropriately cash settled.

 **Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:**

* Analyze assigned general ledger accounts.
* Explain period\-over\-period variances for assigned general ledger accounts.
* Evaluate the recorded journal entries to ensure compliance with IFRS standards and the Bank’s accounting policies.
* Reconcile complex general ledger accounts related to the Bank’s product offerings (i.e. mortgages, securities, mutual funds, overdraft account, deposits, and credit cards) and ensure timely identification and resolution of all reconciling items.
* Reconcile complex general ledger accounts related to the Bank’s operational activities (i.e. payroll, fixed assets, stock\-based compensation, leases, foreign currency accounting etc.) and ensure timely identification and resolution of all reconciling items.
* Review and compile the daily reconciliation package. This also involves understanding the source, process and rationale for all entries booked to the general ledger.
* Investigate, follow\-up and resolve complex reconciliation issues spanning multiple channels and a multitude of vendors and systems.
* Co\-ordinate activities with external vendors and staff in other departments to investigate and resolve issues and to design and implement improvements.
* Train and assist less experienced team members in executing their job responsibilities. This also involves answering queries of the junior members.
* Ensure compliance with SOX requirements with respect to the assigned general ledger accounts.
* Assist with answering external audit queries as well as preparing material requested by the auditors.
* Assess the financial control processes to ensure adequate controls over mortgage investments, credit card and other banking products.
* Identify and initiate process improvements to reduce manual effort and maintain accuracy and controls.

 **Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? \- We'd love to work with you if you have:**

  

* Education/Experience
	+ Minimum 3\-5 years of relevant work experience in accounting
	+ Minimum 2 years of reconciliation experience
	+ Experience working with mortgages, retail deposits, overdraft account and credit card reconciliation.

  

* Professional Certification
	+ Completion of a financial accounting designation is an asset (Canadian or overseas)

  

* Specialized Knowledge
* + Expert level understanding of IFRS requirements
	+ Strong understanding of all Banking products including, but not limited to, mortgages, investments, mutual funds, credit cards, overdraft accounts and retail deposits

  

* Technical Skills
* + Exceptionally strong analytical skills
	+ Systematic approach to problem solving
	+ Strong computer skills with advanced proficiency in Excel and Access

  

* Abilities
* + Proven ability to multi\-task and to prioritize competing priorities
	+ Demonstrated past track\-record of successfully meeting tight deadlines

  

* Attributes
* + Very detail oriented
	+ Logical, clear, uncomplicated and organized thinking
	+ Excellent verbal and written communication skills
 **Working Conditions**


The Senior Accountant, Finance Control and Analysis will be working in a traditional office environment and may be subject to special working conditions as needed by the business. Special working conditions may cover a range of circumstances from regular evening and weekend work, overtime, shift work, working outdoors and/or working with challenging clients.

Tangerine is Canada’s leading direct bank. We offer flexible and accessible banking options, innovative products, and award\-winning Client service. The reason why Tangerine employees come to work each day is to help Canadians live better lives. We focus on making a difference in our communities, and that includes our own internal community. It’s important to us that our employees feel empowered and enthusiastic about belonging to our Orange culture.

  

As Canada’s leading digital bank, Tangerine technology is at the heart of everything we do. We have redefined what digital banking is, and we continue to evolve to tackle any opportunity and face every challenge through progressive technology and the power of collaboration.

  

Do you like new challenges? Are you ready to reach new heights in your career and become part of an established disruptor? If so, come join us and help redefine the Canadian banking landscape!

 **What you will be doing:**

  

Our design team is growing, and we're looking for an experienced Lead Product Designer to join our innovative and collaborative team. We live and breathe product design and thrive on creating user experiences that truly stand out. If you’re an inspiring leader and strong communicator who knows how to build and lead high\-performance design teams, you're the one we want.  

  

As a Lead Mobile Product Designer, you will play a pivotal role in shaping and enhancing the omni\-channel experience. Your primary objective will be to lead a team of native designers in crafting seamless, engaging user journeys and interactions through design research, compelling visuals, and strong UX principles.

 **Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:**

  

* Team Leadership: You will lead and manage a team of designers, setting clear goals, providing guidance, and ensuring the team's effectiveness and efficiency.
* Strategic Planning: You will contribute to strategic planning by conducting user studies, identifying client and business needs, and aligning the UX strategy with business objectives, working closely with your peers.
* Mobile Acumen: You’ll not only lead and manage a team of native mobile designers, but also roll up your sleeves and design when needed. To support your team effectively, you must have a deep understanding of native mobile experiences, including the nuances between iOS and Android platforms. You should know their UI guidelines inside and out and be able to apply best practices to create intuitive, platform\-consistent designs.
* Design Direction: You will be responsible for providing design direction ensuring a consistent experience across all touchpoints. This includes creating design guidelines and processes, reviewing design artifacts, and providing feedback to the team.
* Stakeholder Management: Acting as a liaison between the design team and other stakeholders, such as product managers, engineers, and executives, to advocate for usercentered design and negotiate design decisions.
* Hands\-on Design and Support: In a lean, flat team environment, you will need to be hands\-on with design work and provide direct support to the product team when needed, including creating wireframes, prototypes, or design assets, and collaborating closely with the product team to integrate the experience into the product development process.

 **Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? We'd love to work with you if you have:**

  

* You bring 7\+ years of product design experience, including 2\+ years leading high\-performing teams.
* You possess the positivity and energy to lead and inspire a high\-performing team.
* You have excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross functional teams.
* You enjoy coaching and mentoring designers, from UX methodology to the latest design trends, and even the nitty\-gritty of design tools.
* You have an eagle eye for catching inconsistencies and are meticulous in design quality assurance.
* You have proven experience as a User Experience leader with a strong track record and a portfolio of successful projects.
* You have proficiency in Figma, interactive prototyping, animation, and conducting UX studies.
* You have a deep understanding of design systems and a strong knowledge of how to collaborate with a design system team to further evolve an existing system.
* You thrive in both in\-person/in\-office collaboration and remote work settings, demonstrating adaptability and effectiveness in diverse work environments.
* You have in\-depth knowledge of UI frameworks and guidelines for mobile and web.
* Experience in financial institution or related industry is a bonus.

 **What's in it for you?**

  

* Work in a mission\-driven culture that prioritizes empowerment, diversity, and continuous learning.
* Join a modern banking environment where design plays a central role in shaping client value.
* Be part of a high\-visibility team that is reimagining the future of personal finance in Canada.
* You will get our help to save for your future and to invest in your total wellbeing through our Tangerine benefits\*.
* You belong here, we are equal and un\-complicated. Bring your true self to work, dress codes don’t apply here.
* You will enjoy workspace flexibility and all the excitement that comes from working at the official Bank of the Toronto Raptors.

* Tangerine employees participate in Scotiabank’s pension \& benefits programs (available to permanent employees)

The Information Technology (IT) department manages the technology and computer infrastructure that drives Tangerine’s business systems.


The IT department supports the organization in these critical areas: End\-User Technical Support, Desktop Management, Network Management, Voice and Data Communications, Business and Web Applications and Strategic Technical Planning.


The Technical Support Analyst is responsible for the implementation, administration, and technical support of Tangerine’s Wintel Active Directory environment from an installed applications perspective. The Technical Support Analyst will combine solid technical knowledge, strong analytical skill and hands\-on working experience in the administration and support of the Windows platform, maintaining a highly secure, reliable and optimized operating environment. The Technical Support Analyst of Applications will report directly to the Manager \- Technical Support and Services, Applications (Global Platform Engineering).

 **Is this role right for you?**  

* Administration, maintenance and technical support Enterprise Active Directory, CyberArk and all the Microsoft suite of products (SCCM, SCOM, Office 365, Orchestrator).
* Administration, maintenance and technical support of the McAfee Endpoint Advanced suite of products.
* Assist with the selection, design, build, and implementation of new Windows based applications and operating system technologies as well as supporting Tangerine standards and usage guidelines.
* Assist with the administration and maintenance of an Enterprise Active Directory environment.

Tangerine is Canada’s leading direct bank. We offer flexible and accessible banking options, innovative products, and award\-winning Client service. It’s important to us that our employees feel empowered and enthusiastic about belonging to our Orange culture.

 **The Team**

  

Scotiabank’s Security Advisory Services team is responsible for providing advisory services to Tangerine Bank and it’s business lines, subsidiaries and affiliates enabling the achievement of the Bank's Information Security as it continues to move to the Public Cloud.

 **The Role**

  

Reporting to the Senior Manager of Security Advisory (Tangerine), the Information Security Advisor provides guidance to business lines to ensure design, development and implementation of complex projects and initiatives are in accordance with the Bank's Information Security Standards and in compliance with industry regulations. In this role, you will be supporting various business lines while assisting them in making informed decisions to protect information assets deployed in Public Clouds environments.

 **Is this role right for you? In this role, you will****:**

  

* You have a strong experience leading complex projects providing security advise to ensure information security risk are mitigated.
* You thrive in solutioning for multiple security domains (Application Security, Data Protection, Cloud Security Engineering, Identity and Access Management, Cloud Security Architecture, Network Security, Risk Management, etc.) and knowledgeable of Zero Trust Architecture principles.
* You have experience in solutioning security architecture, creating and reviewing security patterns, and advising on security risks.
* You are proficient in reviewing architecture and solution design documentation and can identify and assess potential risks.
* You excel in reviewing Technical Design and Security Design documents and creating assessment documents (Threat Risk Assessment) and evaluating risks.
* You are passionate about new technologies and enjoy the challenges of implementing security controls to protect them.
* Working on different types of projects (from large complex to simple) is a part of your DNA.
* You love to collaborate with various business lines, IT support functions and IS\&C Control functions

 **Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? We'd love to work with you if you have:**

  

* Post\-secondary education in Computer Science or in a related field.
* You have at least 5 years of hands\-on technical working experience in performing security assessments on cloud platforms, CI/CD deployment pipelines, network infrastructure and complex applications. Experience with Risk Assessments of applications migrated into the Cloud Environments.
* You have at least 5 years experience in security solution architecture, software development, and/or hands\-on experience with implementations of cloud environments, security controls and cloud\-based solutions.
* You are a strong communicator and capable of creating clear documentation and communicating ideas to others
* You have solid knowledge of cloud technologies and cloud security (GCP or Azure or AWS, Kubernetes and IAM, CI/CD pipelines, Terraforms, infrastructure as a code).
* Experience with GCP and Kubernetes is a strong asset.
* Experience with tools used in securing cloud deployments such as CNAPP, CSPM, CWPP, etc.
* You have cloud security engineering or cloud solution architecture certifications from Google, Microsoft or AWS.
* You have used industry leading productivity tools to produce quantitative/qualitative reports, data flow diagrams \& visual presentations.
* Certifications (CISSP, CISM, CCSP, CRISC) are nice to have.
* Familiar with industry standards and frameworks e.g., NIST 800\-53, ISO 27001, ISO27002, ISO 27017, ISO27018, PCI DSS, CIS.
* You possess advanced communication (verbal/written/presentation) skills in English. Knowledge of Spanish is an asset.

 **Key Job Accountabilities:**

  

* Provide strategic guidance and technical expertise to business lines, IT support functions, and IS\&C Control functions to include security within early stages of the design of Bank´s technological solutions.  

Providing the following functions to Tangerine/Scotiabank’s Initiatives:
* Conducting Threat Risk Assessments and performing security advisory work on specific applications and infrastructure associated with Scotiabank’s Cloud and other Initiatives ensuring that controls are adequate, meet Bank standards, and enable business objectives.
* Conducting Risk Management activities.
* Provide Quality Assurance on Threat Risk Assessments and Threat Modelling as required for Cloud initiatives. Provide strategic guidance and technical expertise on security solutions and recommend best practices.
* Conduct comprehensive security assessments on large high\-profile initiatives implemented in GCP and Azure.
* Collaborate with cross\-functional teams to design and implement robust security architectures for various systems, applications, and networks.
* Evaluate existing security solutions and propose enhancements or new designs to address emerging threats and business requirements.
* Ensure alignment with industry best practices, compliance standards, and organizational security policies.
* Identify security weaknesses, vulnerabilities, and gaps in existing systems and recommend remediation strategies.
* Provide support on how to apply the Bank's portfolio of standards to the technology footprint of Scotiabank’s Cloud offering.
* Provide oversight over the specific line of business security posture, ensuring that all tools available to detect and remediate security risks have been applied.
* Conduct industry reviews and benchmarking exercises to ensure our controls are aligned with our peers, emerging threats, and available mitigation strategies.
* Working directly with technical leads from assigned Lines of Businesses supporting their initiatives from an Information Security perspective.
* Providing relationship management function primarily to the Tangerine and Enterprise Cloud team from an Information Security perspective.

description:
**Numéro de la demande:** 245553

  

Tangerine est la plus importante banque directe au Canada. Nous offrons des options bancaires souples et accessibles, des produits novateurs et un service à la clientèle primé. La raison pour laquelle les employés de Tangerine se présentent au travail chaque jour est d'aider les Canadiens à vivre une meilleure vie. Nous nous efforçons de faire une différence dans nos communautés, et cela inclut notre propre communauté interne. Il est important pour nous que nos employés se sentent responsabilisés et enthousiastes à l'idée d'appartenir à notre culture d’entreprise.

 **Qui nous sommes :** L’équipe du Centre contact clientèle est au cœur de nos opérations. En joignant notre Centre de contact, vous découvrirez un milieu de travail inclusif dont l’excellence a été soulignée par de nombreux prix et qui offre un service à la clientèle de qualité hors pair. Au cours de votre carrière à Tangerine, vous ferez l’expérience d’une culture d’entreprise axée sur la reconnaissance et les récompenses, la diversité et l’inclusion, ainsi que sur nos valeurs fondamentales que sont le respect, l’intégrité, la passion et la responsabilisation.

  

Des leaders des services bancaires s’emploieront à nourrir et soutenir vos aptitudes et vos compétences pour favoriser votre réussite et votre perfectionnement.


Tangerine reconnaît la valeur de la diversité et son apport à l’expérience de ses équipes et de ses clients.


Vous serez accueilli au sein de la famille Tangerine et aurez accès à une communauté autochtone importante et en pleine croissance, où vous pourrez réseauter, échanger et apprendre avec les membres de notre équipe issus d’une communauté autochtone et leurs alliés. Nous encourageons aussi ceux et celles qui se font le porte\-voix de l’intersectionnalité et avons divers groupes de ressources pour les employés qui correspondent à votre style de vie et à votre parcours.

 **Spécialiste bilingue, Service clientèle – Tangerine**


La technologie à Tangerine, la principale banque numérique du Canada, est au cœur de tout ce que nous faisons. Nous avons redéfini ce qu’est une banque numérique et nous continuons à évoluer pour saisir toutes les occasions et relever tous les défis grâce à une technologie de pointe et au pouvoir de la collaboration.

  

Vous aimez relever de nouveaux défis? Êtes\-vous prêt à mener votre carrière vers de nouveaux sommets et à faire partie d’une entreprise novatrice bien établie? Si c’est le cas, joignez\-vous à nous et aidez\-nous à redéfinir le paysage bancaire canadien!

 **Vos responsabilités**


À titre d’ambassadeur de la marque au sein de notre Centre de contact, vous ferez partie d’une équipe qui offre aux Canadiens un service primé et des solutions bancaires de premier ordre. Votre rôle de spécialiste, Service clientèle, vous amènera à interagir avec les clients en leur fournissant un soutien exceptionnel pour effectuer leurs opérations bancaires courantes, à leur expliquer les canaux libre\-service et à leur recommander de manière proactive des produits qui répondent à leurs besoins financiers.


Cette fonction vous convient\-elle? Voici les principales responsabilités de son titulaire :

* offrir aux clients un service professionnel et courtois durant les appels entrants et sortants, et par l’intermédiaire des services numériques, dans un environnement dynamique;
* interagir avec les clients en leur fournissant un soutien exceptionnel pour effectuer leurs opérations bancaires courantes et leur recommander de manière proactive des produits qui répondent à leurs besoins financiers;
* renseigner les clients sur une vaste gamme de produits financiers (p. ex. compte\-chèques, compte d’épargne, etc.) et les canaux libre\-service afin qu’ils puissent trouver eux\-mêmes les ressources en ligne;
* favoriser le règlement au premier contact en relevant les obstacles à l’excellence du service et en travaillant à leur élimination.

 **Embauche et formation:**

* Date d’entrée en fonction : Janvier 2026
* Type de poste : Temps plein (37,5 heures)

 **Formation et quart de travail**

* Le candidat doit être disponible pour suivre une formation en personne à notre bureau à Moncton pendant une période pouvant aller jusqu’à 11 semaines. Le candidat doit faire preuve de souplesse et être disposé à travailler le matin, l’après\-midi et le soir, y compris les fins de semaine et les jours fériés entre 7 h et 0 h (minuit).

 **Avez\-vous les compétences vous permettant de réussir dans cette fonction? Nous serions heureux de travailler avec vous si vous remplissez les exigences suivantes :**

* Solides compétences en anglais et en français, tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit
* Grande curiosité, ce qui contribue à répondre aux besoins des clients et à élaborer des solutions
* Détermination à offrir un service à la clientèle exceptionnel
* Facilité à résoudre les problèmes et les conflits
* Capacité d’apprendre facilement et de s’adapter rapidement aux technologies d’un Centre de contact
* Aptitudes marquées pour la gestion du temps et grand sens de l’organisation
* Expérience dans la vente ou le commerce de détail ou dans un autre environnement de service à la clientèle, un atout

 **Qu’avez\-vous à y gagner?**

* Vous ferez partie d’une équipe diversifiée et inclusive, composée de personnes motivées et axées sur la clientèle, désireuses d’apprendre les unes des autres dans un environnement qui célèbre et reconnaît les réussites!
* Vous aurez accès à des milliers de cours en ligne et en présentiel, ce qui vous permettra de façonner votre carrière avec le soutien de divers leaders du secteur.
* Nous vous aiderons à épargner pour votre avenir et à investir dans votre bien\-être grâce aux avantages sociaux de Tangerine\*.
* Vous avez votre place ici, nous sommes égaux et faciles à vivre. Soyez vous\-même au travail.
* Vous bénéficierez d’un espace de travail souple et de toute l’excitation que procure le fait de travailler à la Banque officielle des Raptors de Toronto.

* Les employés de Tangerine participent aux régimes de retraite et aux avantages sociaux de la Banque Scotia (offerts aux employés permanents).

  

Tangerine valorise les compétences uniques que chaque employé apporte à l’équipe. Nous nous engageons à offrir un environnement inclusif et accessible pour tous. Si vous avez besoin de mesures d’adaptation durant le processus de recrutement et de sélection, veuillez en informer l’équipe de recrutement.


Emplacement(s): Canada : Nouveau\-Brunswick : Moncton

Si vous avez besoin de mesures d’adaptation pendant le processus de recrutement et de sélection, veuillez en informer notre équipe de recrutement.
