title: Site Reliability Engineer (SRE)

description:
**Requisition ID**: 235995


Tangerine is Canada’s leading direct bank. We offer flexible and accessible banking options, innovative products, and award\-winning Client service. The reason why Tangerine employees come to work each day is to help Canadians live better lives. We focus on making a difference in our communities, and that includes our own internal community. It’s important to us that our employees feel empowered and enthusiastic about belonging to our Orange culture.

  

Do you like new challenges? Are you ready to reach new heights in your career and become part of an established disruptor? If so, come join us and help redefine the Canadian banking landscape!

 **What you will be doing:**


Senior Performance Engineer provides support to the Performance Engineering Lead and is responsible for the execution of Performance Engineering activities within IT feature delivery. Responsibilities include working with delivery teams in the development of testing strategy, design, execution, defect management and analysis relating to performance testing tasks as well as working with members of the PE team in coaching, process improvement of internal policies and procedures. The Senior Performance Engineer will report directly to Manager or Senior Manager, Quality Engineering.

 **Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:**

* Act as point of contact for Performance testing across delivery team and other areas of IT as required in evaluating intake requests and defining initial testing scope as pertaining to Performance across all channels
* Directly support and execute day\-to\-day performance testing activities within test region and production, working with delivery teams and other areas of IT (enterprise architects, solutions architects, development) to validate performance testing and non\-functional requirements
* Utilize a variety of testing techniques which support the performance and non\-functional testing activities, single user profiling, spike, stress, endurance, fail over
* Assess the risks associated with the development aspects of each solution/project and define a performance testing approach and strategy
* Analyzes, recommends and implements engineering suggestions to improve efficiencies and increase responsiveness of client project requirements, ensure technology is current and up to date with industry standards while maintaining established service levels
* Coach and provide mentorship to the large Quality Engineering team in areas including performance testing strategy, test automation and non\-functional testing approaches, as well as business domain, while ensuring the PE team is compliant with Tangerine test methodologies and industry best practices
* Manage and execute testing activities across multiple large scale enterprise\-wide programs/projects for Tangerine that are executed in Waterfall or Agile methodology
* Risk Management – document testing risks and provide mitigation and contingency plans from testing standpoint.
* Develop and maintain continuous performance testing within CICD pipelines and support /maintain performance tests and metrics gathering to ensure system stability and trending analysis
* Collect strategic, technical and operational test metrics across testing and production environments. Analyze current defects and test execution trends and extrapolate data for predictive analysis
* Ensure all test assets, execution results/analysis, sign off and closure reports are captured within JIRA
* Drive the creation, support and on\-going maintenance of the Tangerine Performance Engineering knowledge repository, tools, and testing strategy and processes.
* Responsible for consolidated test dashboards outlining key metrics and performance KPI’s for Senior Management.
* Work PE team lead and QE management in support of discussion and discovery with vendors related to testing methodologies, tooling, resources, POCs, etc.

 **Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? We'd love to work with you if you have:**

* + University or College Degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science/Engineering
	+ 6\+ years of experience working within SDLC/TDLC
	+ 5\+ years of testing experience specifically within the Performance testing discipline
	+ Proficient testing background in the Canadian financial services industry
	+ Solid understanding of Performance test process methodologies, approaches and tools
	+ Extensive experience test planning and management tooling
	+ Ability to understand enterprise scale infrastructures and emerging technologies such as DataPower, Microservices, Mobile Native Apps, Akamai services, middleware technologies, Various DB services, complex networks
	+ Experience working with cloud technologies such as GCP, AWS, Anthos
	+ Solid understand of web and mobile applications and related implementations
	+ Must have Unix/Linux Intermediate experience
	+ Must be strong in one of the coding languages: Java, JavaScript, python etc.
	+ Knowledge of web services and implementing APIs
	+ Sound knowledge about SQL / PL\-SQL, stored procedures and SQL Server database
	+ Solid understanding of hardware utilization and related Garbage Collection and memory footprints
	+ Expertise in metrics gathering and developing dashboards and reports which clearly and concisely capture and communicate performance testing analysis / results
	+ Demonstrated competency with various tools including Defect Management Tools, Requirement Management Tools, Test Management and Planning Tools, Web Content Management tools and concepts, Banking systems and their integration
	+ Extensive experience with Performance testing and automation tools such as JMeter, LoadRunner, Cloud test, Selenium, Appium or similar
	+ Hands on experience with Performance engineering and monitoring tools such as Sumo Logic, Dynatrace, Crashlytics etc.
	+ Hands on experience within API REST/SOAP testing and experience using related tools, Postman, Rest Assured etc.
	+ Experience with CI/CD and related tools and techniques; Jenkins/Dockers/Kubernetes an asset
	+ CTFL, ISTQB, CSQA, CSTE good to have
	+ Development background an asset

 **What's in it for you?**

* You will be part of a diverse and inclusive team of Client\-focused go\-getters looking to learn from each other in an environment that celebrates and recognizes success!
* You will have access to thousands of online and in\-person courses so you can shape your career growth with support from diverse industry leaders.
* You will get our help to save for your future and to invest in your total well\-being through our Tangerine benefits.
* You belong here, and we are equal and uncomplicated. Bring your true self to work, dress codes don’t apply here.
* You will enjoy workspace flexibility and all the excitement that comes from working at the official Bank of the Toronto Raptors.
